message_1: A rectangular container has a base area of 0.5 m² and a height of 1.5 m. It is filled with an oil of density 820 kg/m³ up to a depth of 1 meter. Find the pressure at the bottom of the container in Pascals.
message_2:
To find the pressure at the bottom of the container, we can use the formula for hydrostatic pressure:

P = ρgh

where P is the pressure, ρ (rho) is the density of the fluid, g is the acceleration due to gravity, and h is the height of the fluid column.

In this case, the density ρ is 820 kg/m³, the acceleration due to gravity g is approximately 9.81 m/s², and the height of the fluid column h is 1 meter.

Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

P = (820 kg/m³)(9.81 m/s²)(1 m)

P = 8038.2 kg m/s² m²

Since 1 Pascal (Pa) is equal to 1 kg m/s² m², the pressure at the bottom of the container is:

P = 8038.2 Pa
